snippet: A panel established by Congress found that too little money is spent trying to find environmental causes and ways to prevent the disease.
abstract: Report from a group of scientists, government officials and patient advocates established by Congress finds that too little money that federal government spends on breast cancer research goes toward finding environmental causes of disease, including behaviors like alcohol intake and exercise, and ways to prevent it.
lead_paragraph: A panel established by Congress found that too little money is spent trying to find environmental causes and ways to prevent the disease.

headline.seo: Report Faults Priorities in Breast Cancer Research
headline.main: Report Faults Priorities in Studying Breast Cancer
headline.print_headline: Report Faults Priorities In Studying Breast Cancer
